title: "What is the process of 'tasting the essence' through magnetic methods in alchemy?"
first_phrase: In this last 200-token part, the focus is on the connection between time and essence, and how attaining the quintessence can result in a shift in one's perception of time. The concept of the quintessence is related to the "sensorium commune" of Franz Anton Mesmer and the practice of concentration on the navel, which symbolizes the "center of the earth." The text explores the importance of ritual and regularity in exercising one's mind and asserts that developing a connection to one's nature is essential to achieving the quintessence.

last_phrase: In conclusion, understanding the different psychological types and their relationship with elemental energies can help us become more aware of our own emotions and reactions. By controlling our sensory impulses and emotions, we can live in the present, acquire more knowledge, and develop spiritually. Training, practice, and specific techniques such as massage, relaxation response, and alchemical exercises can aid us in this journey. As philosopher Israel Regardie said, "Understanding is the key to transformation."
